title: Mechanics v. Knowledge
body: I'm starting to realise that a lot of what I thought was mechanics, is actually just USING the correct knowledge, correctly.

replies.body:
It comes down to the level of mechanics or knowledge... and also the champions you plan on using... 
Let's pretend 1 is for level 5 mechanics, and 10 is for Faker mechanics
if you were 1 knowledge 10 mechanics I'd estimate you'd get to maybe Gold 3
but remember... you would never get Faker's level of mechanics and have the knowledge of a level 5.... 
so by improving your mechanics your knowledge of the game should gradually increase as well... 

I don't know what qualifies as knowledge either, like if knowledge counts as
x spells + x summoner spell = dead opponent

or Blitz q + graves ultimate is down for approximately 13 more seconds, we have this window of opportunity to all in and kill them....

or does knowledge qualify as knowing when opponents are mia and having wards so you don't die?

I look at knowledge as a decision you've made out of reason rather than reaction. 

Dodging a skill shot is mechanics.
Knowing when that is off cooldown and hence coming at you is knowledge. 
I feel even if you don't have the best mechanics you can cut down your reaction time just by the information of what's coming when.
As Francis Bacon said, "Knowledge is Power"!

Cause you can learn mechanics :D.
I don't know how to improve reaction times.
But I can learn exactly what's coming, how much it's dealing and how often.
